channel.title: Archlinux on The Realm of Space
channel.description: Recent content in Archlinux on The Realm of Space

item.title: Recently upgraded Windows on my dual boot laptop causes problems on my bootloader.
item.description: So I upgraded my Windows software to the latest insider preview and it kind of messed up my laptop. Here’s the error message: EFI stub: ERROR: failed to read file. Trying to load files to higher address EFI stub: ERROR: failed to read file. Here’s the step I did to resolved it. Boot in an ArchLinux liveusb. Mount your root and boot partition. Chroot into it. And reinstall the bootloader.

item.title: Compiling the latest beta kernel in ArchLinux
item.description: You have a new laptop, you install ArchLinux on it and seems like a some things is missing. Certainly this is the case for me, one of this is suspend feature, when doing, my laptop just seems to boot as if I shutdown it, my application is not persisted. Another is a fix for my headphone noise issue, just to name a few. Some things is missing! One of the few things you can try is to install the latest beta kernel.
